normalised: Manufacturing and Supply Chain: Vendor Audits Tightened Amidst Festival Season

unnormalised: **Manufacturing & Supply Chain: Vendor Audits Tightened Amidst Festival Season**
normalised: Mumbai, October twenty six – As Diwali preparations ramp up across India, manufacturing and supply chains face increased scrutiny. Companies are tightening vendor audits to ensure product quality and ethical sourcing practices ahead of the peak festive season.

unnormalised: Mumbai, Oct 26 – As Diwali preparations ramp up across India, manufacturing and supply chains face increased scrutiny. Companies are tightening vendor audits to ensure product quality and ethical sourcing practices ahead of the peak festive season.
normalised: Leading Chennai-based auto component manufacturer, Sundaram Fasteners, announced stricter compliance checks across its vendor network, focusing on raw material quality and adherence to labor laws. This follows concerns raised about potential cost-cutting measures impacting product safety.

unnormalised: Leading Chennai-based auto component manufacturer, Sundaram Fasteners, announced stricter compliance checks across its vendor network, focusing on raw material quality and adherence to labour laws. normalised: Industry analysts suggest these audits are crucial to prevent substandard goods from entering the market during high-demand periods. "Consumers expect consistent quality, especially during festivals. Imagine a batch of faulty kitchenware ruining Onam celebrations – the reputational damage would be significant," says Mister Sharma, a supply chain consultant from I I M Bangalore.

normalised: Recent audits in the textile industry in Tiruppur revealed discrepancies in labor wages and factory safety. Major retailers are now demanding third-party certifications from vendors to ensure compliance. Sources say increased focus is also being placed on food safety amongst vendors supplying ingredients for popular festival treats and ready-to-eat biryani packets.
